name: RunHistoricalDetectionJob
description:
Initiate a historical detection job in Datadog.

Use this tool to start a historical detection job via Datadog's SIEM API. It is called when there's a need to analyze past data using historical detections.

parameters.name: historical_job_request_data
parameters.description: JSON object containing the job parameters for running a historical detection job, including rules, queries, and job options.

from.description: Starting time of data analyzed by the job.

id.description: ID of the detection rule used to create the job.

index.description: Index used to load the data.

notifications.description: Notifications sent when the job is completed.

to.description: Ending time of data analyzed by the job.

fromRule.description: Definition of a historical job based on a security monitoring rule.

duration.description: Duration of the action in seconds. 0 indicates no expiration.

flaggedIPType.description: Used with the case action of type 'flag_ip'. The value specified in this field is applied as a flag to the IP addresses.

userBehaviorName.description: Used with the case action of type 'user_behavior'. The value specified in this field is applied as a risk tag to all users affected by the rule.

actions.description: Action to perform for each rule case.

condition.description:
A case contains logical operations (`>`,`>=`, `&&`, `||`) to determine if a signal should be generated
based on the event counts in the previously defined queries.

cases.description: Cases used for generating job results.

from.description: Starting time of data analyzed by the job.

groupSignalsBy.description: Additional grouping to perform on top of the existing groups in the query section. Must be a subset of the existing groups.

index.description: Index used to load the data.

evaluationWindow.description:
A time window is specified to match when at least one of the cases matches true. This is a sliding window
and evaluates in real time. For third party detection method, this field is not used.

baselineUserLocations.description:
If true, signals are suppressed for the first 24 hours. In that time, Datadog learns the user's regular
access locations. This can be helpful to reduce noise and infer VPN usage or credentialed API access.

impossibleTravelOptions.description: Options on impossible travel detection method.

keepAlive.description:
Once a signal is generated, the signal will remain "open" if a case is matched at least once within
this keep alive window. For third party detection method, this field is not used.

maxSignalDuration.description:
A signal will "close" regardless of the query being matched once the time exceeds the maximum duration.
This time is calculated from the first seen timestamp.

forgetAfter.description: The duration in days after which a learned value is forgotten.

learningDuration.description:
The duration in days during which values are learned, and after which signals will be generated for values that
weren't learned. If set to 0, a signal will be generated for all new values after the first value is learned.

learningMethod.description: The learning method used to determine when signals should be generated for values that weren't learned.

learningThreshold.description: A number of occurrences after which signals will be generated for values that weren't learned.

newValueOptions.description: Options on new value detection method.

evaluationWindow.description:
A time window is specified to match when at least one of the cases matches true. This is a sliding window
and evaluates in real time. For third party detection method, this field is not used.

stepTransitions.description: Transitions defining the allowed order of steps and their evaluation windows.

evaluationWindow.description:
A time window is specified to match when at least one of the cases matches true. This is a sliding window
and evaluates in real time. For third party detection method, this field is not used.

steps.description: Steps that define the conditions to be matched in sequence.

defaultNotifications.description: Notification targets for the logs that do not correspond to any of the cases.

rootQueries.description: Queries to be combined with third party case queries. Each of them can have different group by fields, to aggregate differently based on the type of alert.

signalTitleTemplate.description: A template for the signal title; if omitted, the title is generated based on the case name.

thirdPartyRuleOptions.description: Options on third party detection method.

dataSource.description: Source of events, either logs, audit trail, or Datadog events.

distinctFields.description: Field for which the cardinality is measured. Sent as an array.

hasOptionalGroupByFields.description: When false, events without a group-by value are ignored by the query. When true, events with missing group-by fields are processed with `N/A`, replacing the missing values.

metrics.description: Group of target fields to aggregate over when using the sum, max, geo data, or new value aggregations. The sum, max, and geo data aggregations only accept one value in this list, whereas the new value aggregation accepts up to five values.

queries.description: Queries for selecting logs analyzed by the job.

checkPresence.description: Whether to include or exclude the matched values.

columnName.description: The name of the column in the reference table.

logFieldPath.description: The field in the log to match against the reference table.

ruleQueryName.description: The name of the query to apply the reference table to.

tableName.description: The name of the reference table.

referenceTables.description: Reference tables used in the queries.

query.description: A query to map a third party event to this case.

thirdPartyCases.description: Cases for generating results from third-party detection method. Only available for third-party detection method.

to.description: Ending time of data analyzed by the job.

data.description: Data for running a historical job request.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.
